task.title: My First Task
task.shortdesc: The Laser D project requires adherence to certain procedures to ensure its successful completion.

prereq.p: When working on the Laser D project, here are some protocols you want to follow:

ul.li: Collect a batch of discs from your library's collection. Bring a cardboard box with you to the area where the Laser D collection is located at your library. Fill the cardboard box with discs.
Carry the CDs over to your workstation. Carry the discs from the storage area of the Laser D collection to your cubicle or workspace.

Select a case, open the plastic lid cover, and carefully remove the disc.Hold a Laser D disc between the fingers at the outer edge. Inspect the disc for any damages and make a note of them in your notebook.
Insert the disc into the drive.Once the disc is pulled into the drive, run the SAS program.

context.p: The protocols involved in processing Laser D discs may seem mundane, but they are crucial in the migration of corporate document files.

step.cmd: Start the SAS program by clicking the "running man" button.
step.info: The program will extract all of the documents stored on the disc.

step.cmd: Wait for all of the documents to appear on Microsoft Windows, look for any corrupted files, and make a note of them in your notebook.

taskbody.result: You have adheared to the protocols for processing a disc, thus guaranteeing the safe migration of corporate document files.
